Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Nath meets Shah, seeks funds for new ant.description: BHOPAL: Chief minister Kamal Nath called on home minister Amit Shah in New Delhi on Sunday to discuss issues related to internal security and law and order in the state. This is Nath's first meeting with Shah after he became home minister. Nath, who is in Delhi for the first meeting of Niti Ayog under the aegis of new NDA government, arrived at Shah's residence in the evening, said sources in Mantralaya. The two spoke for almost an hour, and women safety was a key part of their discussions. After the meeting, Nath is believed to have sent a letter to Shah, seeking budgetary support of Rs 880 crore to set up a special cell in MP to prevent crimes against women and children.  "Financial assistance will be required to set up a cell to check crimes against women, procure equipment for investigation, reorganize mounted troops and dog squad, and hire counsellors to deal with cases of crimes against women. This will require technically skilled manpower, patrol vehicles and office buildings," Nath has said in the missive.  The new cell will comprise investigating officers, legal advisers, prosecutors and counsellors, apart from DNA laboratories and mobile forensic teams, the CM ha written. "Crime against women and children is a sensitive issue. The state government is committed to strictly deal with offences against women and children. For this, support from the central government is urgently required," says his letter. The meeting between the two stalwarts holds significance after BJP's thumping majority in the recent Lok Sabha election, where Shah - as BJP president - had raised the issues of "mass transfers and deteriorating law and order" in Madhya Pradesh in his poll rallies. BMC hopeful of rains in a week, but read.description: BHOPAL: With barely 10 days of water remaining in the Upper Lake, water resources are running dry in the state capital. Around 17 colonies along Hoshangabad road are dealing with dry tubewells. However, the Bhopal Municipal Corporation (BMC) is optimistic that as per predictions, the monsoon will arrive in the next week and bring the much needed relief. According to BMC estimates, Upper Lake water supply can be maintained up to 1,649 feet. “Water would last till June 30. Till then, pumping of water from Upper Lake would continue,” said a BMC official. There have also been glitches in the water supply from Narmada and Kolar due to power outages. BMC would begin its ambitious drive for environmental protection and lake conservation. Under the campaign, Upper Lake's revitalization work would begin along the Bairagarh stretch of the Upper Lake. Clean-up of the catchment area is vital to water flowing into the Upper Lake. The programme was scheduled to begin from Tuesday but has been postponed for a day, according to BMC sources. Meanwhile, the BMC has a new plan to provide water to areas only connected with Upper Lake water supply. The plan was discussed with senior urban development officials. Sources said that alternate day water supply, additional water tankers and other contingencies are being worked out. It is estimated that water supply from Idgah Hills filtration plant could stop pumping water from July 1, if the Upper Lake water level does not increase by then. Around five lakh people get water from the Upper Lake. For the moment, BMC has ruled out restriction on use of water on construction and other sites. Government officials indicate that about 70,000 labourers and others could get adversely impacted in case of restrictions being introduced on water use. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal: 10-year-old girl electrocuted ne.description: BHOPAL: A 10-year-old girl was electrocuted when she came in contact with a live wire on her way to school. The incident was reported from Adityapuram area on Wednesday morning. Pari Tomar, a student of Gwalior’s Greenwood School, was going along with her friends when she was electrocuted. Local residents have blocked the roads in protest against the incident following which additional force has been deployed. Police have registered a case for further investigations. Bhopal custodial death: Govt will take a.description: BHOPAL: State home minister Bala Bachchan has said that the state government will inquire and take necessary action into the death of a youth in police custody in Bairagarh in the early hours of Wednesday. The minister also hit out at BJP leaders and said wards have turned aggressive and were taking law into their own hands and stringent action will be taken if anybody is found guilty. “Cops are investigating the death of a youth in custody in Bairagarh area. The government will take necessary action against cops if they are found to be guilty in the incident”, Bachchan told reporters at his official residence on Wednesday. The home minister also hinted stern action against those involved in attacks and other crimes. When asked about the incident in Narsinghpur, Bachchan said, “Sons of BJP leaders Prahlad Singh Patel and Kamal Patel are taking law in their hands. If someone breaks the rule of law, the government will take action. An FIR has been registered against 20 persons in the Narsinghpur incident”. Replying to allegations by former BJP minister Jalam Singh Patel that Congress government has turned revengeful against BJP leaders and registering fake cases against their family members, Bachchan said that the state government has no time for revenge politics. “Do you think that the government has time to do vendetta politics? No, we do not have time for this. But, anybody who breaks the law will have to face very stringent action”, said the minister. Meanwhile, the state BJP has attacked the Congress government for turning ‘insensitive’ towards common people. BJP national vice-president and former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that police in Madhya Pradesh has turned autocratic and Congress has lost control over the police and administration. “It is extremely shameful that cops have turned autocratic and the government has lost control over the administration. The government has turned insensitive. There should be fair probes in the case related to son and nephew of Union minister Prahlad Patel”, said Chouhan. Leader of Opposition (LoP) Gopal Bhargava also condemned the death of the youth in police custody at Bairagarh. “There is no control over law and order in the state. Only mass transfers are being done by the Kamal Nath government . BJP will raise the issue of custodial death in the coming session of the Vidhan Sabha”, he said. Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Flight to Kolkata: MP chief secretary to.description: BHOPAL: In a bid to connect the state-capital with north- east part of the country, city’s Raja Bhoj airport may get a flight to Kolkata. State chief secretary SR Mohanty has decided to hold talks with Air India in the matter. A high-level meeting, attended by airlines’ representatives and state government officials, was held on Monday. All possible options to connect the state capital with Bagdogra Lucknow, Bhubneshwar, Ahmedabad, Chandigarh and Amritsar, apart from Kolkat, wer discussed. Sources said CS Mohanty, in the meeting, expressed concern over capital’s zero air connectivity with eastern part of the country. He said that he would discuss the issue with Air India. Bhopal commissioner Kalpana Shrivastava said efforts are on for better air connectivity. “Several destinations including Kolkata are there which could be connected with Bhopal airport.” A flyer said, “Around 60,000 people of West Bengal, many of Odisha and other north eastern states are living in the capital, therefore, itcould prove to be a feasible route for airlines. Lack of flights forces them to travel by train, which makes their quite journey, so the issue must be addressed,” said a flyers’ group head Prachi Baluapuri. Flyers had even tweeted for more than 10,000 times in a day demanding Bhopal-Kolkata flight last one month. Also, the train connectivity from Bhopal to Kolkata is also not very good, with only four direct trains in a week. “We have checked the railway reservation availability, but there are no ticket available this month for Patna and Kolkata. I have received queries from many flyers demanding Bhopal-Kolkata air route,” said another flyer. Interestingly, after the number of flights increased from the Bhopal airport, the daily footfall also rose from 500 to 2000. “Whether it is Bengaluru, Jaipur, Ahmedabad, the flights have been fully packed. Similarly, it will benefit if flight to Kolkata gets started from Bhopal,” said flyers. Currently, airlines including Air India, IndiGo and Spice Jet are operating from the state-capital, connecting nine destinations. The airport was connected to only three cities — Delhi, Raipur and Mumbai — till December 2018. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPeople enjoy Bhangra themed party in B.description: Theme-based parties are one of the biggest draws for the club-hopping crowd in Bhopal and one such celebration recently drew a big crowd.  Organised at a club, this Bhangra party saw guests sporting colourful pagdis and dancing enthusiastically to rocking Punjabi beats that echoed through the pub.  As the dholwala played some peppy beats, the footloose partygoers could be seen matching their steps and performing some traditional bhangra steps. Foot-tapping music, free-flowing beverages and a lot of cheery camaraderie made the night a memorable one as the young crowd made the most of this unique theme-party. Madhya Pradesh HC gives child\u2019s cus.description: BHOPAL/JABALPUR: A single-judge bench of MP high court ordered handing over children of a person, accused of killing his wife, to their paternal grandparents as desired by the child’s father, who is in jail under judicial custody. The children had been taken away by their maternal grandparents to Bihar after the alleged murder of their mother by the father. The court suggested that father being the only natural guardian of the child in the absence of mother was entitled to take a decision as to where his son should stay. Paternal grandparents, Bhramarkant Jha and his wife, residents of Anuppur district in MP, had filed a habeas corpus petition after their grand son and grand daughter, aged eight and six years respectively, were taken away by his maternal grandparents to Saharsa in Bihar after their father allegedly shot dead his wife and wife of his brother at his house in Anuppur. Now, he is in jail under judicial custody. In their habeas corpus petition, Bharamkant and his wife said that their son, Nirmal Jha, is accused of murder of his wife Pooja and wife of his brother, Archana on August 5, 2018. After his arrest, Pooja’s parents, Indra Kumar Jha and Sudha Jha, came down from Bihar and took the children with them. They said that their son wished that the children stayed with their paternal grandparents and prayed the court to handover custody of the children to them. After they were produced in the court on Tuesday, Justice Atul Sreedharan in his brief order said “pursuant to the orders passed on April 30, 2019, the children have been produced before this court by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha, who are the maternal grandparents of the children. They have been requested to handover the children to Bhramarkant Jha, who is the paternal grandfather of the children. It is relevant to state here that the father of these children, who is presently in judicial custody, had desired that his children be with his parents on the basis of which Bhramarkant Jha filed this writ petition for habeas corpus. The children had been taken away to Sahersa in Bihar by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha. But, as stated herein above, they have produced the corpus before this court. They are also handing over the custody of the corpus to the petitioners today in the presence of the court.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. \nChhattisgarh Mahotsav kick-started at.description: The seven day long Chhattisgarh Mahotsav recently kick-started at the Bharat Bhawan with a sculpture and painting exhibition and sitar recital among other things. The sculpture and painting exhibition highlighted the creations of 20 artists including Anant Mahamalla, Kuldeep Singh, Yogendra Tripathi, Tikendra Kumar Sahu, V Nagdas, Kishore Sahu, Deepak Verma, Rajendra Sundaria, Harish Sen, Sunita Verma, Anand Vaishnav, VV Raman (Kiran), Sheikh Hibzul, Bhanu Prakash, Ashish Kushwaha, Jhumuk Das, Sushma Agrawal, Anand Tehenguria, Yashpal Chandrakar and Hukumlal Verma. Next in line, was the sitar recital by Pandit Buddhaditya Mukherjee who played the Raag Yaman Kalyan. This was followed by energetic and mesmerizing performance of Pandavani singer Teejan Bai who began her performance with Karna Prasang. The venue was jam packed for her energetic performance. Madhya Pradesh: Union minister\u2019s so.description: BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh police have registered a case of attempt-to-murder against the son and nephew of Union minister Prahlad Singh Patel following a clash in Narsinghpur district in which five persons, including a policeman, were injured, around midnight on Monday. Prabal, son of Prahlad Patel, and his cousin Monu — son of former Madhya Pradesh minister Jalam Singh Patel — are among 12 persons booked for attempted murder. One of those injured was shot and is in hospital. “It was a clash between two groups over some petty issue at Bailhai locality of Gotegaon town. Some members of both groups have sand mining licenses in the area. Prabal Patel, son of Prahlad Singh Patel, Monu Patel, son of Jalam Singh Patel, and 10 others were in one group that beat up members of the other group,” Gotegaon police station in-charge, Prabhat Shukla told TOI. A homeguard jawan, Ishwar Chand Rai, was injured when he went to save his son who was among those beaten up, said Shukla, identifying the other injured as Himanshu Rathore, Rahul Rajput, Mayank Mishra and Shivam Rai. Rathore has suffered a bullet injury. “Monu is a history-sheeter. More than 40 cases are registered against him. We are looking for all the accused and have sent the injured to Jabalpur for treatment,” said Shukla. Union minister Prahlad Singh Patel is in Delhi, where Lok Sabha is in session, and could not be contacted. His brother Jalam Singh Patel — a former minister in Madhya Pradesh government — called it a political conspiracy. “It is politically motivated action. My son Monu and nephew Prahlad were not present on the spot. Both of them have been framed in the case. I demand a fair investigation. If the mobile location of Monu and Prabal is tracked, things will be clear immediately,” Jalam Singh Patel told TOI. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal: Action against kiosks for overch.description: BHOPAL: Action has been taken against 10 kiosk centres following complaints of irregularities in the online admission process under College Chalo Abhiyan. These kiosks are 4 of Gwalior, 2 of Bhopal and one centre each of Sagar, Morena, Narsinghpur and Khandwa. Commissioner higher education Raghavendra Singh said that on receiving complaints from Sagar, Morena, Gwalior, Hoshangabad and Bhopal of students being charged with more amount by the centres, spot verification was conducted by district coordinators. On finding the complaints true, the kiosk operators were instructed to return the amount and their ID’s were cancelled. Singh said that according to higher education minister Jitu Patwari’s instructions, the online admission of girl students has been made free. He said that criminal case would be registered against the kiosk operators if they charge the students or engage in any fraud. In the first phase, nearly 2.89 lakh were registered in graduation and post graduation including 1.52 lakh girls and 1.36 lakh boys. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nCitizens enjoy Zumba workshop during R.description: Week after week, people from across age groups gather for the Raahgiri celebrations — exercising, walking and dancing their way to good health. And this week was no different.  While throngs of youngsters as always attended the Zumba workshop, it was heartening to see an increasing number of older people also making their way for the dance session. Burning calories by grooving to peppy numbers seem to be attracting more and more Bhopalites to come for these rigorous sessions. A lot of guests could also be seen walking next to the lake. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Bhopal: Abducted bizman jumps off moving.description: BHOPAL: A 29-year-old businessman was allegedly abducted and robbed of Rs 1.3 lakh cash by three men, who worked at his shop, in the wee hours of Wednesday in Hanumanganj. However, the victim, Salman Khan, somehow managed to escape and approached the police. Investigating Officer SI Praveen Thakre said that Khan runs a car accessories shop on Hamidia Road. He alleged that around 12.30am, he closed his shop. The accused, Salman, Sameer and Yaman, who work at his shop, misled him telling that a short-circuit had occurred inside the shop. When Khan when he went inside, the trio allegedly grabbed him from behind. When he resisted, they stifled him with a sedative-laced cloth. "They took him inside a four-wheeler. Around 3pm, when he came into his senses, he found that he was in the back seat of a car and two men were driving it towards Bhanpur area," said SI Thakre, adding that the Khan somehow managed to jump off the moving car near Chhola. Builders welcome 20% slash in Collector.description: Bhopal: State government decision to cut down the collector guideline prices by 20 per cent gave the much awaited relief to the real estate sector and the builders welcomed the decision. Kamal Nath led state government cut down the collector guideline prices of land/property by twenty per cent in the cabinet meet held on Tuesday, while increasing the stamp duty by 2 per cent from existing 7.3 per cent to 9.5 per cent in entire state and for urban areas stamp duty would be 12.5 per cent instead of existing 10.3 per cent.Spokesman, CREDAI Manoj Singh Meek said “We welcome the move. Now, there will be a positive sentiment in the sector after long time because of the government’s decision. Transaction in real estate sector had come down sharply due to over valuation of properties over the years.” We are yet to get the complete details of cabinet decision, but it will increase momentum in the real estate sector, he added.Similarly, Fortune Builders, managing director, Ajay Mohgaonkar also hailed the decision. It will lead to easing out additional burden on the sector. Real estate market would improve with the move and positive sentiment in market will help in coming up of new projects, he added.Not only builders, but also political leaders of Bhopal and other cities were opposing increase in collector guidelines rate. District evaluation committee (DEV) in Bhopal proposed to raise collector guideline prices of land/property at about 350 places in the district.MLA from Bhopal’s central constituency, Arif Masood, the only legislator in the committee, had opposed increase in collector guideline rates and when the DEV ultimately decided to recommend increase in rates at nearly 350 places in Bhopal, he allowed the proposal to go only with his dissent note last week.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

E-tendering scam: EOW summons two ex-sec.description: BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh state economic offences wing on Tuesday summoned two government officers, who were secretaries to former BJP minister Narottam Mishra, for questioning in connection with the probe into the alleged Rs 80,000 cr e-tendering scam. Notices have been issued to Nirmal Awasthi and Virendra Pandey, who were on deputation from water resources department and law department to Mishra's office. Sources in the agency said they will be questioned in connection with a tender awarded to Gujarat-based Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co in 2018. Sources say Awasthi went to the EOW office on Wednesday to have his statement recorded. The water resources department had floated a Rs 116-crore tender for a project that the firm bagged for Rs 113 crore, and when the letter of acceptance was given, the amount was reduced to Rs 105 crore, say sources. EOW investigation to focus on rates, tendering procedureFirst of all, the tender went at a low rate and then there was further reduction of around Rs 8 crore. We want to know the reason for the modification in rates and investigate the tendering procedures,” said an EOW official. Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co, a company registered in Vadodara, was granted a 30-day ‘transit temporary anticipatory bail’ from Gujarat high court, following a joint petition moved by 10 people associated with the firm. The bail period ended a couple of days ago and EOW officials are trying to arrest those named in their FIR, say sources. The petitioners — Meghli Velji Sorathia, Ashok Velji Bambhaniya, Diwaliben Sorathia, Bharat Sorathia, Chandresh Sorathia, Mahesh Sorathia, Haresh Sorathia, Paresh Sorathia, Manoj Vasava and Raju Gehani — had informed the court that they apprehended arrest in connection with the FIR registered by EOW in Bhopal and sought bail, said sources. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Union minister's son in police remand in.description: BHOPAL: Union minister Prahlad Patel's son Prabal and six others accused of attempted murder were produced in court on Wednesday. Police took Prabal in custody for a day; and the rest got jail remand. Police teams have fanned out to look for the other accused, including Prabal's cousin Monu, whose father Jalam Singh Patel was a minister in the BJP government. "We urged the court for remand of accused Prabal Patel for a day, which the court accepted," Narsinghpur SP Gurukaran Singh told TOI. Prabal - a first-year college student in Bhopal - was arrested on Tuesday along with six others after a clash in Narsinghpur's Gotegaon town injured five persons, including a policeman. One of those hurt has a bullet injury. Police have found that two of the injured - Himanshu Rathore (who was shot) and Rahul Rajput - used to work with the accused's group earlier but have now shifted to a rival group. "The dispute probably broke out as they wanted the duo to work for them again," the SP said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Nityata youngest from MP to become Woman.description: Bhopal: World Chess Federation ( FIDE) has awarded women FIDE master title to 15-year-old chess player Nityata Jain. Now Nityata will be known as Woman Fide Master (WFM) Nityata Jain in the international chess world. She is the youngest girl from MP to achieve this feat.Nityata, a student of DPS Nipania in Indore, has been a consistent performer for the past four years in national and international circuits. Incidentally, she is the only WFM from Madhya Pradesh. Earlier, Kiran Agrawal had received WFM title when Chhattisgarh was part of MP. The WFM title is the third highest title awarded at the international level to women chess players who achieve international Fide chess rating of 2100 or above points. Recently on June 1, 2019, Nityata had increased her international chess rating by whopping 294 points in just one month to 2219 which helped her win the WFM title.Earlier, Nityata was awarded international chess title of woman candidate master (WCM) by World Chess Federation in 2018. Nityata has now crossed the minimum rating criteria of 2200 which is required to achieve her the Woman International Master (WIM ) title from World Chess Federation. Now she requires 3 WIM norms to achieve second highest international female chess title in the world.In order to achieve her goal, Nityata should continuously undergo grandmaster chess coaching as well as play more and more international tournaments, said her father Nitin Jain. “Exposure in grand master coaching and international tournaments will also enhance Nityata's chess knowledge and experience which will help her win more medals for India and MP,” said Nitin.So far, Nityata has brought laurels to India and MP by winning 7 international medals, 2 national school medals and 19 state gold medals in her chess career. Presently, Nityata is participating in the Balanton International Chess Festival IM Tournament. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Five of a family killed in road accident.description: BHOPAL: A police constable, his wife and their three daughters died after the car they were travelling in rammed into a stationary earth-moving machine in Sagar district early on Tuesday. The driver of the car also sustained serious injuries in the accident. Police said that the family had reached Sagar two days ago to attend a wedding function. Subhash Sapre, the constable, was posted in Chachoda in Guna district and was on the way back home in his car with his family when the mishap took place at Khurai Bypass. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

120km trip for ear surgery, all in vain.description: Bhopal: Hospital services at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Bhopal were thrown out of gear, owing to doctors stir, here on Monday. the all-India day-long strike called by Indian Medical Association (IMA) found support in AIIMS Bhopal, where regular OPD was just over 341, according to union government’s e-hospital dashboard. By Monday evening, hospital administration came out with an OPD figure of more than 1,500. Eye-witnesses said that more than 500 patients who had come seeking medical treatment from other towns to AIIMS Bhopal were disappointed. Bari Bareli resident Ram Bai was scheduled for an ear operation on Monday. Not aware of the stir, she travelled 120 km for more than four hours to find out that hospital services were shut-down. “There was not prior intimation. I am not sure when the surgery would take place,” she said. There were many others who were disappointed over the situation. Even though, emergency services were functional, the route to finding emergency care was difficult. Hospital wings near the registration counter were locked down. In each of the departments of AIIMS Bhopal, the number of doctors was insufficient even for emergency care. AIIMS emergency and trauma was only functional. Emergency patients were affected too as doctors staged protest at the entrance of the hospital. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal custodial death: A family's agony.description: BHOPAL: A pall of gloom descended on physically challenged Mishra couple after their only son Shivam's death in police custody in the wee hours of Wednesday. They accused cops of looting and murdering their 26-year-old son. Shivam's father Suresh Mishra, an ASI with cyber cell, said: "What was my child's fault? He was going to have dinner and his SUV met with an accident. He too belonged to a policeman's family but cops assaulted him mercilessly." Shivam's family members protested outside the Hamidia mortuary and refused to get his post-mortem conducted until a murder case was registered against the guilty policemen. The family reached the mortuary early morning and remained there till evening until judicial probe was ordered. Shivam's mother Sangeeta and sister Madhu silently sat beside his body and cried inconsolably. Suresh's brother Deepak Mishra is an SI in Indore. Shivam's uncle Hridyesh Bhargava denied that he was drunk at the time of the accident. He alleged that police forced alcohol in his nephew's mouth after his death to cover their crime. Shivam's aunt Soma Sharma alleged that he was whipped with police belts and had welts on his back. Shivam's friend Govind, who was with him at the time of the accident, also accused the cops of assaulting them. He said cops ignored his pleas that he had chest pain. Shivam's friend Pratap Singh Rajput said that when he met him outside Bairagarh police station after the accident, he was "fit and fine". "Then, cops took him somewhere in garb of a medical examination and misled us for two hours. We found out about his death around 4am. The medical report said Shivam was declared brought dead at 2.20am but cops hid the information from us," Pratap said. TIMELINE OF A TRAGEDY11.30 PM: Shivam picks up Govind in his SUV from Depot Square for dinner at a dhaba in Khajuri Midnight: They crash into railings on BRTS corridor near Christian Cemetery 12.20 AM: A Dial-100 FRV arrives to find a crowd of 150 already gathered 12.48 AM: Shivam and Govind taken to Bairagarh police station 1 AM: Shivam’s friend Rajput, who he had called right after accident, arrives at Bairagarh police station. Shivam tells him that cops are beating him and Govind 1.19 AM: Police take Shivam to hospital for medical examination. He has a bruise on his head and doctor says he is drunk 1.48 AM: Shivam brought back to police station; case registered against him 2.07 AM: Shivam feels restless, steps out of police station and collapses. Taken to hospital where he is declared dead (Rajput, still waiting for Shivam at police station, is told that he was taken to Hamidia and then a private hospital) 4 AM: Rajput and Govind told Shivam is in Civil Hospital, behind the police station. They find his body lying on a stretcher outside hospital 4.47 AM: Rajput informs Shivam’s family Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nCM Shivraj Singh Chouhan inaugurates P.description: The three day Police Kala Mahotsav was inaugurated recently by Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan at Bharat Bhawan. The program opened with an exhibition highlighting the services rendered by the police officials in the form of paintings, poems, photographs and sculptures along with a play titled Vardiwale. A rare collection of books from the police headquarters was also kept on display for the exhibition. The collection included books from 1867 till post-independence. German box cameras invented in 1954 and paintings highlighting the tough life of police officials, made by students and artists from various states, were also on display.  Directed by Ashok Bulani and written by Vijay Shankar Mehta, Vardiwale, based on a true incident that happened in Ujjain around 20 years ago, saw mature acting and perfect dialogue delivery, thereby leaving the audiences spellbound. UAHD guidelines to curb dog menace in Ma.description: BHOPAL: MP Urban Administration and Housing Development (UAHD) has come out with new guidelines for curbing dog menace in city areas. UAHD principal secretary Sanjay Dubey, in a circular sent to all local bodies and district collectors, has instructed them to take immediate measures to curb dog menace. UAHD now aims to reduce the canine population, promote sterilization and immunization of all dogs within a span of two years. UAHD directive began with a cautionary note, in case some urban bodies go overboard with the move. UAHD has cited Preventions of Cruelty Against Animals Act, 1960 and Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules, 2001 and MP Human Rights Commission’s (MPHRC) directives over the issue and the reduction of man-dog conflict. MPHRC has taken note of media reports over deaths due to dog bites in Bhopal. UAHD wants to begin with a dog count in each city. Urban development notice stated that current plan to curb dog menace isn’t sufficient and ineffective and hence it wants all urban bodies to complete sterilization and immunization of dogs within two years after conducting a demographic survey. UAHD wants more dog pounds, kennel shelters within city limits to cater to dogs, which are ill or in need of proper care. In Bhopal, the district administration has already allocated land in four locations. The order focuses on having dog squads matching the population of dogs in a city. The teams should be available and able to reach on the dog bite site within a stipulated time limit. Dog population would also determine the number of vehicles each municipal body would have for the task. The establishment of Animal Birth Control Monitoring Committees at local authority levels in accordance with Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules is indispensable for the success of the program. The constitution of the monitoring committee is provided in Rule 4, and the functions that it is required to perform are provided in Rule 5. Besides, pre-surgical checks, dogs assessed to be incurably ill or mortally wounded shall be dealt with in the manner prescribed in Rule 9 of the Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules. Street dogs suspected to be rabid have to be dealt with strictly in the manner prescribed in Rule 10 of the Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules, 2001. To confirm rabies, the brain sample of every street dog suspected to have died of rabies must be sent to the closest accredited laboratory and a report must be obtained for every death under this category. 24X7 availability and dispensation of rabies injection has also been mandated. HC castigates SHRC for violation of ADG\.description: Bhopal/ Jabalpur: A single-judge bench of MP High Court on Wednesday quashed all the directions given by the State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) to ascertain whether father of additional director general (ADG) of police, Rajendra Mishra, was dead or alive, holding that it was in violation of his right to privacy which is as sacrosanct as right to life and liberty. Based on media reports that Mishra’s father Kulmani Mishra had died and yet his son was keeping his “lifeless” body in his house, SHRC directed the director general of police (DGP) on February 14, 2019, to find out whether death of Kulmani Mishra was natural or unnatural, whether the body was cremated and if not, what scientific steps were taken by Rajendra Mishra to preserve the body and report back to the commission within three days. The DGP replied on February 18 that the doctors of Bansal Hospital, where Mishra’s father was being treated, declared him dead but Mishra didn’t allow the police to enter his house. Then, the SHRC on February 19, 2019 directed for constitution of two teams of medical expert from allopathy and ayurvedic medicine, which shall visit Mishra’s house with a police officer of the rank not less than superintendent of police (SP) to find out whether Mishra’s father was alive. It was against these directives that Mishra and her mother had moved the high court, describing the same as violative of their right to privacy.The court of Justice Atul Sreedharan, while taking note that there has been no complaint of foul smell emanating from Mishra’s residence and a practitioner in ayurvedic medicine has presented a certificate that he was treating Mishra’s father, said, “Even if SHRC believed that Mishra’s father was no more, it had no business to intrude into his private life using agencies of the state.” “Thus, the act of the petitioner No. 2 (Rajendra Mishra), even assuming arguendo that his father is no more and he has kept the human remains in his residential premises, by itself does not become an illegality, warranting intrusive action by the State. A regime, which forbids everything save only those things that are expressly allowed, would be regarded as a bullying power-structure, while a regime which permits everything save only those things that are expressly forbidden, would be counted liberal by contrast. India falls in the latter category being a liberal democracy where a man is permitted to act in any manner he pleases, where such act is not prohibited under the law, irrespective of the fact that his act might be seen as galling by the majority”, said Justice Sreedharan.He further said “Thus, the petition succeeds, the impugned direction given by the respondent no. 2 (State Human Rights Commission) to the State is held to be violative of the right to privacy of the Petitioners and thereby violative of the fundamental right to life of the Petitioner as enshrined under Article 21 of the Constitution. Therefore, the same is quashed”.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Congress video shows former chief minist.description: BHOPAL: Congress on Tuesday released a video, which purportedly shows former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan talking to someone (presumably some officer) and asking him to let a group of tribals enter the city “peacefully”. The group was stopped on the outskirts of the city. “Main unko lene aa rahan hun. Main Bhadbhada aa rahan huin. Yeh galat baat hai. Aap baat karo. Yadi shantipurna chahte ho to unhe aa jane do, nahin to ashanti ho jane do”. (I am coming to take them. I am coming to Bhadbhada. This is not right. You talk. If you want peace, let them come in and if you want violence, let it be so),” Chouhan is allegedly heard is saying over the phone. Commenting on the video, Congress media cell coordinator, Narendra Saluja, said: “This is Shivraj Singh Chouhan, who has been chief minister of the state for 13 years. Look at his language, how he is threatening officers … to let people come into the city with their tractor trolleys without permission. He is threatening of violence, threatening to gherao Vallabh Bhavan. He is openly challenging the law & order. He has also used ‘pitthu’ adjective for collector in the past.” Chouhan, when contacted for comments, said: “Let them circulate the videos. How does it matter? They had permission to come into the city. They have been evacuated from their habitat and were not being allowed to voice their grouse here as well. Is it democracy? They asked tribals, including small children, to park their tractor-trolleys 8-10 Km away from the place where they were permitted to assemble. Why? Don’t tribals have a right to live, to protest? Let them make videos, I have said this and would continue fighting for the poor all my life.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman jumps into fire to save house from.description: BHOPAL: A 50-year-old woman made for herself a pyre and jumped into the flames to protest an anti-encroachment drive by the administration in Morena, Madhya Pradesh. She is battling for life with 50% burns. Locals set fire to a JCB machine and wrecked the tehsildar’s car in the violence that followed. The district administration had sent a team to raze the house of Ram Avatar in Ganpat Ka Pura village of Morena as it allegedly encroached upon land of a temple trust, said sources. The demolition team, led by a tehsildar, arrived with a JCB machine. The team faced resistance as soon as they arrived. Ram Avatar’s wife Rajabeti piled up a stack of hay, set it on fire and before anyone could stop her, jumped into it. Violence broke out immediately. A mob damaged the tehsildar’s vehicle, torched the JCB and attacked firemen who were trying to put out both fires. In the melee, officials rescued the badly burned woman and admitted her to hospital. Locals blocked Ambah-Porsa Road, and it took a lot of persuasion by senior officials to get them disperse. Morena SP Asit Yadav said, “The situation is completely under control. The blockade has been removed and road opened. The injured woman had been admitted at hospital where her treatment is underway.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Custody of children of person accused of.description: Bhopal/Jabalpur: A single-judge bench of MP high court ordered handing over children of a person, accused of killing his wife, to their paternal grandparents as desired by the child’s father, who is in jail under judicial custody. The children had been taken away by their maternal grandparents to Bihar after the alleged murder of their mother by the father. The court suggested that father being the only natural guardian of the child in the absence of mother was entitled to take a decision as to where his son should stay. Paternal grandparents, Bhramarkant Jha and his wife, residents of Anuppur district in MP, had filed a habeas corpus petition after their grand son and grand daughter, aged eight and six years respectively, were taken away by his maternal grandparents to Sihersa in Bihar after their father allegedly shot dead his wife and wife of his brother at his house in Anuppur. Now, he is in jail under judicial custody. In their habeas corpus petition, Bharamkant and his wife said that their son, Nirmal Jha, is accused of murder of his wife Pooja and wife of his brother, Archana on August 5, 2018. After his arrest, Pooja’s parents, Indra Kumar Jha and Sudha Jha, came down from Bihar and took the children with them. They said that their son wished that the children stayed with their paternal grandparents and prayed the court to handover custody of the children to them. The court in response to their petition had directed Anuppur police to produce the children and their maternal grandparents in the court. After they were produced in the court on Tuesday, Justice Atul Sreedharan in his brief order said “pursuant to the orders passed on April 30, 2019, the children have been produced before this court by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha, who are the maternal grandparents of the children. They have been requested to handover the children to Bhramarkant Jha, who is the paternal grandfather of the children. It is relevant to state here that the father of these children, who is presently in judicial custody, had desired that his children be with his parents on the basis of which Bhramarkant Jha filed this writ petition for habeas corpus. The children had been taken away to Sahersa in Bihar by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha. But, as stated herein above, they have produced the corpus before this court. They are also handing over the custody of the corpus to the petitioners today in the presence of the court. ASI Pramod Verma, Bhalumada, district Anuppur, is present before this court. His further presence is discharged. In view of the same, the purpose of the petition has been served and the same is disposed of as such.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Madhya Pradesh HC commutes death sentenc.description: BHOPAL/JABALPUR: A division bench of MP high court on Monday commuted the death sentence awarded to a 19-year-old boy, who had raped and killed his five-year-old cousin at a village under Katangi police station in Jabalpur district. The court commuted the death penalty to life sentence, but specified that the accused would remain in jail for 30 years. The court held that the case is based on circumstantial evidence and therefore court has to be more cautious and circumspect while awarding death sentence, besides the accused is only 19 years of age and possibility of his reform and rehabilitation can’t be ruled out and the crime is not a ‘rarest of rare’ crime. “It is a case of circumstantial evidence in which the principle of prudence applies. In the cases of circumstantial evidence, while awarding sentence of death penalty clinching cogent evidence ought to be looked into with more care and circumspection in exceptional cases otherwise in a case of circumstantial evidence the death penalty may not be prudent” said Justice J K Maheshwari and Justice Anjuli Palo. They said, “In the present case, the age of the accused is 19 years and the possibility of reformation and rehabilitation of his entire career cannot be shut down. Simultaneously, it is observed here that nothing has come on record as well as in the finding of the trial court as to why the rehabilitation and reformation of the accused is not possible and such observation of the court is based on the hypothesis and without any basis. As per the report received from jail, the behaviour of the accused is prudent and unquestionable, therefore, in our considered opinion, the policy of reformation and rehabilitation cannot be ruled out in the case of accused who is 19 years of age. The observation made by the trial court while recording the finding that the accused may be dangerous to the society is based on presumption and hypothesis, which cannot be accepted without any basis. In this regard the prior and subsequent antecedents of the accused in the jail are relevant, which do not draw any inference in negative side as observed by the trial court. In view of the foregoing observation and in our considered opinion, the conviction of the appellant-accused recorded by the trial court for charges under section 363, 366-A, 376(2)(f)(i) and 201 of the IPC is hereby affirmed, but on the point of sentence for an offence under 376A read with section 376-AB and 302 of IPC, it is not one of the rarest of rare case in which option of other punishment has been unquestionably foreclosed. Therefore, we commute the death penalty to imprisonment for life. It is made clear that the sentence of life imprisonment of the appellant would mean sentence of 30 years.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Computer Baba \u2018raids\u2019 sand min.description: BHOPAL: After he was denied a chopper for an aerial survey of illegal sand mining in river Narmada, Computer Baba challenged the sand mafia and chased them in a boat on Sunday night. However, his effort went in vain. Not to be outdone, he again “raided” some mines on the banks of Narmada in Sehore district and “impounded three sand-laden tractor trolleys”. Namdeo Das Tyagi aka Computer Baba, with a status of minister, is the chairman of Ma Narmada, Ma Kshipra and Ma Mandakini Trust and is entrusted with the duty of conservation of the rivers. “As the monsoon approaches, there is total ban on sand mining,” Baba told TOI adding: “ I confiscated three tractor trolleys loaded with illegally mined sand from Somalwada village in Budhni tehsil of Sehore district and handed it over to SDO Police and sub-divisional magistrate.” He said, “Most of the sand mining is taking place in Budhni.” On Sunday night, when he was camping at the Circuit House in Hoshangabad, he was told about the presence of many trucks loading sand across the river. “When I saw the trucks being loaded, I decided to cross the river by boat. I had also informed the district collectors of Sehore and Hoshangabad,” he said. “But as I was crossing the river, the boat stuck midway as there was not enough water for the boat to reach at the bank of the river,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gujarat denying 700 MW power to MP daily.description: BHOPAL: It seems Narmada water is all set to become a flash-point yet again between Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat, as the latter has stopped generating power from the riverbed power house (RBPH) at Sardar Sarowar dam, thus denying Madhya Pradesh almost 700 MW of energy every day. MP is also apprehensive that following Gujarat’s decision to store water upto 138 meters in the dam, it may face the issue of submergence as large number of project-affected families are still living in the valley awaiting compensation. According to Narmada Water Dispute Tribunal Award (NWDTA) , MP gets 57% of the power from RBPH. During normal monsoon, Gujarat gets 9 million acre feet (MAF) of Narmada water from the dams of Madhya Pradesh. Now that the two states are ruled by two different political parties, it may compound the problems, political observers said. After getting its full quota of water earlier this year, Gujarat had recently demanded more as it wanted to store water in the dam to a height of 138 meters to test its strength, sources in the state government said. However, Madhya Pradesh reasoned that Gujarat’s decision of storing water at 138 meters would lead to submergence of land in the state where thousands of families have already approached the Grievance Redressal Authority (GRA) regarding compensation. More than 6500 people in the valley in 76 villages may face submergence and this human misery should be avoided, MP stated. After Madhya Pradesh refused to discharge “additional water”, Gujarat stopped generating power in RBPH, sources claimed. Besides 1200 MW power from RBPH, 200 MW power is also generated from canal power house. Now Gujarat has offered about Rs 250 crore to Madhya Pradesh for the loss of about 700 MW of power, sources claimed. Sources said that after Gujarat’s offer of power compensation, the MP government said it wants the neighbouring state to pay an additional Rs 250 as “opportunity cost” as it will have to purchase costly power from the market”. Though the two issues are yet to be resolved, Gujarat continues to store water in the dam, while MP is against discharge of any additional water. Now, Gujarat is banking on heavy monsoon rains in the Narmada valley for MP to release water from its dams after flooding. Minister for NVDA Surendra Singh Baghel said, “Gujarat wants to create a crisis in MP. But we will ensure that all rights of Madhya Pradesh are safeguarded. All the rights of the people in the Narmada valley, including those of farmers, will be protected.” Meanwhile, Medha Patkar of Narmada Bachchao Andolan (NBA) said, “There are more than 30,000 people still living in the valley. The GRA has not been able to figure out how many are living presently in the valley.” She said that the state should seek Rs 3600 crore from Gujarat for refusing to give power from RBPH.
