Bride turns away baraat because groom wa.description: JABALPUR: A baraat in Jabalpur had to take a U-turn, after the bride refused to marry on finding the groom to be drunk. The woman’s refusal triggered tension between both sides of the family, and police had to intervene to settle the issue. The situation was such, that the bride’s family had kept the baraatis hostage. Patan police station in charge, Shivraj Singh Chauhan said, “Marriage of a Jabalpur woman and a Sagar man was being held at Nunsar on Sunday.” Police withheld the names of the bride and groom to protect the identity of the family. “During the initial greeting ceremony, the bride’s family found that the groom was drunk. When they confronted his family, they said, he does not consume alcohol. The bride refused to marry the drunk groom.” “Soon after a dispute broke out over returning the gifts exchanged between them. The bride’s family held the baraati hostage. Police contained the situation and an agreement was reached, after which the baarat returned to Sagar,” he said. “I am happy with my daughter’s decision. She has a master's degree in engineering. We cannot put her through hell,” the woman’s father told TOI. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal youth dies after \u2018assault\u2.description: BHOPAL: A 26-year-old property dealer died after allegedly being beaten by police in the wee hours of Wednesday following an accident in the BRTS corridor in Bairagarh. Five policemen, including an SHO and an SI, have been suspended. During the alleged assault, the victim, Shivam Mishra, kept pleading that he had acute chest pain and needed to go to hospital, but the policemen didn’t relent, says his friend Govind Sharma Podel, who, too, claims to have been beaten in custody. Both Shivam and Govind are sons of police officers. Shivam’s family alleges they were not informed about his death. They refused to let the body be taken for autopsy until the accused cops were booked for murder and loot. They say a gold chain and ring that Shivam wore, his wallet and his mobile phone are missing. “Orders of judicial inquiry into the death of Shivam Mishra have been issued. There will be a fair investigation. Whoever is found responsible will not be spared. Justice will be done to the family,” tweeted chief minister Kamal Nath“A judicial inquiry has been ordered. Anyone found guilty will not be spared. There will be strong action,” DGP V K Singh told TOI. The autopsy report says Shivam died of cardiac arrest and that the other injuries were trivial in nature, said IG Yogesh Deshmukh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NCP stages protest against EVMs.description: Bhopal: The Madhya Pradesh unit of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Wednesday demanded that the Electronic Voting Machines (EVM)s be discarded. Led by its state president, Raju Bhatnagar, the party held a protest outside the office of the CEO. The protesters torched an effigy of the replica of the EVMs and later handed over a memorandum to the CEO. Despite the demand of over 20 political parties to discard the EVMs, said Bhatnagar, the EC did not pay any heed to their demands. The party cited instances wherein it claimed that the functioning of EVMs can come under scanner. In the recently-concluded Lok Sabha elections, too, votes of a number of candidates in the country were same, which raises doubt on EVMs. Several countries, which had adopted the EVMs in the past have now opted for the postal ballots, the party stated its memorandum. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\n46 dancers pay tributes to God through.description: A dance performance worshipping Lord Ganesh, Krishna, Ram as well as Goddesses Durga and Lakshmi was presented by artistes from a dance academy at ‘Nritya Sankeertanam’ at Bharat Bhavan.  As many as 46 students gave a synchronised Bharatnatyam performance under the guidance of Manju Mani Hatwalne. The students started with a Ganesh Vandana in Mohiniyattam, followed by a dance performance Gaiye Ganpati that highlighted the competition between Lord Ganesh and his brother Kartikeya. The other performances included Vaagheshwari Sharde, dedicated to Goddess Sharda, Bho Shambho dedicated to Mahakal and Shambho Mahadevne, a Malayalam bhajan worshipping the Natraj form of Lord Shiv. Vaishnav Janato, a famous Gujarati bhajan, was also presented in Bharatnatyam. Then a Marathi bhajan Sakha Majha depicting 10 forms of lord Vishnu and a Kannada bhajan Bhagyada Laxmi worshipping Goddess Lakshmi was also presented. The dance performances were choreographed in eight different languages. The vocals were by Vidushi Rashmi Ravi, Neela Ramkumar, Shobha Ramesh and Sheya Ravi while Virendra Kore accompanied them on flute, Mahesh Malik on the violin and Ranjini Venkatesh on the mridangam. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018Need to curb rush of Everest climb.description: Bhopal: Megha Parmar, MP’s first woman to reach the Mt Everest summit, has suggested that the Nepal government should minimise the number applications for climbing the world’s highest peak. Megha was in Bhopal to attend a function at Bhojpur Club which gave her a lifetime membership of the club. Notably, this year 11 climbers have lost their lives due to heavy traffic during the summit. Talking to TOI, Megha said that it is unfortunate that this year so many people have lost their lives in their attempt to reach the summit. “Like me it is dream of every climber to complete the summit. However, it is disheartening to see that people are losing lives as traffic has increased significantly,” said Megha. Asked for the reason of such a rush, Megha said, “It is because there is no restriction. Anyone who can pay the fee with even less mountaineering experience can attempt climbing. On the other hand, China not only restricts number of applications but allows only experienced climbers to attempt the summit.” She said that more people are dying because of the lack of proper training. “Even if you have done the certificate course a good climber does lot of training under professional trainers. They put themselves under tough training situation so that they can fight exigencies,” said Megha. She said that despite so many climbers attempting the Mt Everest summit every year the awareness is poor about it. “People ask me the height which I touched at the Mt Everest. It is unfortunate that people do not know even the height of the Mt Everest which are available in several school books,” said Megha. She is willing to coach and teach if she gets an offer. “I have achieved what I wanted to. I have touched the highest peak and now my next target is to touch the lowest point of the world. However, if anyone offers me to train I will do it to motivate others,” said Megha. Incidentally, for three days after completing the summit, Sehore's Megha drifted in and out of consciousness, unable to tell anyone back home that she had achieved her dream. Later, she disclosed her journey of completing the summit. Daughter of a farmer in a landlocked state like MP, Megha always dreamt of standing on the top of the world. After a failed attempt last year, at 5am on May 22 this year she stood on the peak of Mt Everest. Megah had to turn back just 700 metres from the summit last year. Undaunted, she decided to try again. But there was another shock in store. "I had fractured my backbone in three places in a training accident in July last year. But I had promised myself that I will summit within a year, and began training again in November," she said. Her determination paid off, and she was elated to reach the summit. Then, her nightmare began. She also felt victim to the 'traffic jam' near the peak that claimed so many lives this year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nFive-day film festival 'Ekagra' commen.description: Ekagra, a five-day film festival, commenced with the film Bhuvan Shome, directed by renowned filmmaker Mrinal Sen, at Bharat Bhavan.  Made in 1969, Bhuvan Shome was one of the most appreciated films of its era. The fest will continue till July 5 and some of Hindi and Bengali cinema’s best films by Sen will be screened here.  Bhuvan Shome was a film made on a tight budget but it played a key role in establishing Sen as one of the most respectable filmmakers of that time and he won many accolades for it, including best feature film and best direction. The movie is based in the 50s where Bhuvan Shome, played by Utpal Dutt, is a strict but dedicated senior railway officer. His colleagues are always discussing his strictness but Bhuvan continues with his work without paying attention to them.  The film follows his life as he decides to go for a bird hunting holiday where he meets Gouri, a young and beautiful, easy-going girl. Bhuvan is bowled over by her and in turn, she has a great impact on his life and he lets go of his extra strict behaviour. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP takes a dig at govt\u2019s \u2018hal.description: Bhopal: The BJP on Monday took a dig at the state government for celebrating ‘haf-year’ in office even though it has failed to fulfill any of the promises Congress made in its manifesto. BJP leaders said that the government did not even waive farm loans within 10 days as announced by Congress president Rahul Gandhi. The party must change the chief minister for failing to implement the scheme even after six-month of its rule in the state, they said. "The Congress government has accepted in the advertisement published in newspapers that the second phase of the loan waiver scheme will being launched now. This exposes the false claims of the party that it had waived off farm loans within 10 days of coming to power as announced by Rahul Gandhi", said former minister Narottam Mishra while addressing a press conference on six-months of Kamal Nath government. He claimed that 95 per cent of the farm loan beneficiaries in the state have not availed benefits up to Rs 2 lakh as claimed by the Congress. He said in the so-called first phase, farmers got benefit up to Rs 15,000 only on their total loan amount. "Congress has not only fooled the farmers, is also trying to cheat them in the name of PM Kisan Nidhi Yojana. The government is not submitting the complete list of farmers to the Centre for financial assistance of Rs 6,000 per annum under the scheme. So far, only 43,000 beneficiaries have been listed against 80 lakh farmers registered with the state government-run cooperatives and mandis", said Mishra. Taking a jibe at ‘half-year celebrations' of the government, Mishra said that it is for the first time in the country that any government is celebrating `half-year' of its rule. “Is the Congress government not sure completing one-year term in the state?" asked Mishra. He said all promises made by the government and listed in the report card presented before the press on Monday are unfulfilled even after six months of being in power. For every single crisis, they blame the opposition party and now they are celebrating their so-called success, he said. "For power cut, they blamed BJP, for water crisis and crimes, they pointed finger at the BJP. For scams in cooperatives, rape and murder of minors, doctors' strike and what not. They blame BJP for everything. Who is stopping them from taking action against culprits?” said Mishra. He said, “In six months, the government has failed to fulfil a single promise. After cheating farmers in the name of loan waiver, the party has not provided stipend to unemployed youths. The promise to provide scooter to students is still unfulfilled. People are facing acute water and power crisis, now employees were suffering due to mass transfers". Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bundelkhand water woes: Villagers protes.description: BHOPAL: As the only source of water - a tubewell at a local police station - hardly giving any water to Chandera village of Tikamgarh, starts facing acute crisis, villagers here have started a sit-in protest at the district headquarters demanding deepening of the ancient lake before the monsoon begins. For the past three years, in summer, the villagers would make a queue at the police station tubewell to fetch water under the supervision of two constables from 9.30 am to 12 noon. But this time following unprecedented heatwave, not only a Chandela era lake of the village located about 55 kms away from Tikamgarh district headquarter dried up, other water sources have also gone dry. The SHO of Chandera police station said, “water flow in our tubewell is getting thinner and thinner with each passing day.” With no water source left to quench their thirst, villagers decided to highlight their demand. They said last year also they protested for water but the promises made by the then government were not fulfilled. They demand deepening and repairing of the of the ancient lake so that it could fill up in the monsoon and last longer next year. In fact, all the districts of the whole of Bundelkhand region of Madhya Pradesh face acute water crisis. Many villages also witness migration because of water shortage. “Only two private tube wells are functioning in the Chandera village. Most of the people fetch water from distant sources travelling 2 kms to 3 kms every day,” said Ram Pal Mishra a villager. “For how long the people of Bundelkhand will have to cry for the basic needs like water. Denying any water crisis in the village, the sub divisional magistrate Jatara RS Bakna said, “we have already started the work of the deepening of the lake and it will be completed before the onset of monsoon,” Neeru Sharma, a resident of Chandera sitting at dharna said. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. \nPriyanka Chopra, Prakash Jha address t.description: A couple of days before the shooting of Prakash Jha’s Gangaajal 2 wrapped up, the film’s cast got together to interact with the media in the city.  Addressing the crowd, Priyanka Chopra, who plays a tough cop in the film, said, “I will miss Bhopal a lot and having spent a month here, I have fallen in love with the place. The people here are very cooperative and it has been a memorable shooting experience here.”  Besides Chopra, the other actors, including Rahut Bhat, Murli Sharma and Manav Kaul, were also present. Praising the beauty and the cooperation received by them, Jha said, “Bhopal is a place where shooting can be done with ease and the credit goes to the audience here.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A new dawn, future awaits Madhya Pradesh.description: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Kamal Nath has in a blog written on the completion of his six months in office said a new dawn and new future awaits the state. In the blog, Nath wrote, “After a long and hostile summer, monsoon is knocking at your doorstep, bringing with it new hopes. At the same time. it also recalls about the long pain each one of you have endured. Putting it in verse Nath writes, “Scorching heat was far long/ There was no respite/ Never was the weather so hostile/ The scorcher was long…/ 15 long years.” He further wrote, “The heat has singed everything in the state. The sun has affected the economy, good governance, respect to women folks, farmers’ livelihood, employment for youth, self-respect for Dalits and tribal folks. The economic mess left was so that the state had a revenue deficit of Rs 8 lakh crore making it difficult to pay wages of state government employees. On several occasions advances had to be sought from the RBI to meet the crisis. The state had a debt of Rs 1.87 lakh crore and investments failed to make it while there was no trace of good governance and justice. The fact is that 46,000 girls could not save themselves and another 48 lakh children suffered malnutrition. Farmers’ seeking true value for their farm yield were shot by bullets while the future of bright youth were compromised through Vyapam. That is, I inherited a listless administration. But as one say, God may be late but not unjust. Like the saying goes in Hindu mythology that as much Rohini heats there is a chance of good rain. Thus, it seems a happy end with onset of monsoon. First with farmers’ loan waiver at their doorstep and later with discounter electricity for all. Now, there is also a reduction in crimes. Girls are also getting an assistance of Rs 51,000 for marriage. Citizens of the state will now have Right to Water, Metropolitan Planning Authority is scripting a new story of development in the urban areas of the state while new investments are coming with job promise to 70% youth of the state. Houses of poor are being illuminated with subsidized power. It is said that power consumption is the benchmark for development, and in the last six months the power consumption has gone up from 16% to 48%. The state is also providing benefit of 27% reservations to the Other Backward Classes. The last six months has brought a new hope for the state with the girls scaling Mt. Everest, youth brimming with hope and farmers’ assured of better future. There are new opportunities for the tribals, OBCs and Dalits. Cattle are finding homes in good cow shelters and Narmada and Kshipra rivers are also promising to flow with full glory.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Madhya Pradesh: 10-year-old girl electro.description: BHOPAL: A 10-year-old girl was killed when she came in contact with a live wire on way to school. Incident was reported from Adityapuram area on Wednesday morning.  Pari Tomar was going along with her friends when she got electrocuted. She was a Class 4 student of Gwalior’s Greenwood school. Local residents have blocked roads in protest against the incident. The additional force has been deployed. Police have registered a case for further investigations. MP govt cuts collector rates by 20% to b.description: BHOPAL: In a bid to give fillip to the real estate and construction sector, the state cabinet headed by chief minister Kamal Nath on Wednesday decided to slash the collector guideline rates of property to 20%. To compensate the loss, the government decided to increase stamp duty on the registration of property from 7.3% to 9.5% across the state and from 10.3% to 12.5% in select urban areas. "The decision to reduce the collector guideline was taken in view of recession in the real estate sector. Providing support to the real estate would help in employment generation, besides giving boost to related sectors which in turn will kick-start the state’s economy. The decision would be effective after the official notification", state law and public relations minister PC Sharma told reporters after the cabinet meeting. Sharma said the decision would help property buyers to pay actual income tax incurred on the transactions. Earlier, there was a vast difference between the actual property rates and collector rates and the customers had to pay tax as per the collector guideline. "The consumer had to shell out more fee on buying the property against the actual cost paid for the same. The decision would remove the anomaly and help consumer pay the actual income tax on the de- MP encourages women to invest in propertyAfter 2005, there has been a sudden escalation in the property rates across the state which resulted in boom in the real estate sector. But this prompted the district authorities across the state to increase the collector guidelines to generate more revenue from the market. Unfortunately, this proved to be detrimental, resulting in a major slump in the sector, said real estate experts. Finance minister Tarun Bhanot said that the decision to increase the stamp duty on registration of property from 7.3% to 9.5% will help in curbing revenue loss to the state exchequer. He said in urban areas, buyers will have to shell out 3% extra fee like before. The state government has encouraged women to invest in property by reducing the registration fee to only Rs 100. “In case the property rates are more than the current guideline, the transfer fee would be 2.1% of the difference amount. At present, the stamp duty and registration fee on the joint-ownership of wife or daughter is 1per cent and 0.8 per cent respectively. The cabinet has slashed it to Rs 1000 as stamp duty and Rs 100 maximum as registration fee to encourage women empowerment", said Bhanot. He said in case of partition of family property, the stamp duty has been reduced to 0.5% from the current rate of 2.5%. The stamp duty and registration fee on donation of the property have also been reduced to one per cent with maximum amount of Rs 500 and Rs 100 respectively against the current rate of 2.5% and 0.8%, he said. The cabinet also decided to extend the last date of repayment of short term loan or debt drawn on zero percent interest during kharif season 2018 and rabi season 2018-19 to June 30 from June 15, said state commercial tax minister Brijendra Singh Rathore. The cabinet also discussed ways to strengthen the drug regulatory system and decided to open three food and drug labs in Indore, Jabalpur and Gwalior respectively. The cabinet gave its nod to enact Advocate Protection Act and observe December 3 as Advocate Day to mark the birth anniversary of Dr Rajendra Prasad, the first President of India. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
